html: called thee in righteousness. The verse makes five statements about Jesus Christ's mission: he was called…in righteousness, God will guide Jesus (hold [his] hand), God will protect him (keep [him]), Jesus will be a covenant of the people ("i.e., the means through whom people will come into a covenant relation with the Lord" ), and he will be a light of the Gentiles (see also 49:8-9; D&C 45:9). This prophecy has some interesting parallels with that found in 49:1-10; see commentary there.
